result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Edward Benoit

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:05 AM Defendant John Edward Benoit in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for John Edward Benoit.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Rosenthal- client will waive prelim
Court binds defendant over for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:20 PM Defendant John Edward Benoit appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for John Edward Benoit.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State recites prior criminal history. State asks for $1500 signature bond. No contact with HPW. Attorney Hoffman has no objection. 
Court orders $1500 signature bond. No contact with HPW. Defendant asks for preliminary hearing 2 weeks out to accommodate his medical needs.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
